titleStmt.title: A merry progresse to London to see fashions by a young country gallant, that had more money then witte. To the tune of, Riding to Rumford.

notesStmt.note: Verse - "My mother to heauen is gone,".
In two parts, printed side by side; the second part has title: The second part of the merry progresse to London. To the same tune.
Reproduction of original in the Pepysian Library, Magdalene College, Cambridge, England.
